ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Neurobiology 596 is a discussion-based course exploring decision making using the primary literature. The emphasis on critical reading and presentations is very useful.
I would recommend it.A discussion class about neuroeconomics.
I would recommend this course only to somebody who is interested in conducting decision making research using non-human primates.
Rigorous yet accessible introduction to state-of-the-field neuro-economics. Yes, recommended.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Reading the primary literature deepened my knowledge.
I had to get into the nitty gritty of each paper in order to understand it. Since I plan on doing research in this field, it helps alot.
Adds neuro-bio perspective to economic view on health behaviors.
